events.name: Android Auto Code Lab
events.description:
About:
The new Android Auto APIs bring the Android experience in to your car. Android Auto automatically surfaces you useful information and organises it into simple cards that appear just when they're needed. You get notifications about messages on your phone messages, and can play media or browse your phone's content.¬†More information about it here.¬†

Our local Google Developer Expert Paul Blundell and London Google Developer Expert David Gonz√°lez will lead an Android Auto practical hands on code lab, where you will learn how to add Android Auto compatibility to an Android messaging app.¬†

What you‚Äôll learn:¬†

- Extend a notification so that it also shows in your car
- Handle the user replying to this notification¬†

The event will take the form of a guided workshop where we will walk you through the code to create this Android application explaining along the way how the different Android SDK parts work and answering any questions you may have. You will have the chance to pair program (or on your own is ok to!) and to try out your code on a real Android Auto demo unit, not only in the emulator!¬†

Difficulty level: beginner¬†

Prerequisites:
- Laptop with Android Studio and Android SDK preinstalled (or turn up and pair)
- Have git installed to checkout the starting code
- A sense of adventure¬†

Drinks will be provided!

events.name: Post Droidcon Round UP
events.description:
It's time for GDG Liverpool! Let's get together to discuss the recent sessions from Droidcon London.

Agenda:

6:00pm - Arrive, meet & greet

6.30pm - Hello's

6.45pm - Talks & discussions begin

8.00pm - Pub!

Speaker: Paul Blundell, Novoda

Abstract

Paul will lead a discussion and present his experiences from attending this years Droidcon London.¬†He'll touch on best practices architecting applications, reactive java on Android and newest Android version; Marshmallow. Join us to explore the latest and greatest happenings in the Android world!

About the speakers:

Paul Blundell

Paul Blundell is an aspiring Software Craftsman and Senior Android developer at Novoda. Before Novoda he worked at the AutoTrader and Thales with apps he's released racking up over 1 million downloads. A strong believer in software craftsmanship, SOLID architecture, clean code and testing, Paul has used this methodology to successfully nurture and create many Android applications. These include Channel 4‚Äôs new All4 video streaming application, the Tesco Launcher app; pre-installed for the Hudl2 tablet, MUBI a unique film streaming service and the AutoTrader UK car search app.

More TBC

events.name: GDG Liverpool January
events.description:
Kick start 2016 with fresh ideas and join us for the GDG Liverpool January meetup!

Agenda:

6:00pm - Arrive, meet & greet

6.30pm - Hello's

6.45pm -¬†Designing Apps for visually impaired -¬†Ataul Munim, Novoda

7.30pm - TBC

8.00pm - Pub!

Speaker: Ataul Munim

A giant process nerd, Ataul has recently been focused on advocating for accessibility on Android and identifying workflows to facilitate the production of universally useable apps.

Abstract:¬†Making your app suitable for vision impaired users is part of a larger topic on developing accessible apps. We'll cover what it means to be a vision impaired user, and how the term covers a large demographic. We'll then look at ways you can design and implement your apps to better serve such users' needs.

More details soon!

events.name: GDG Liverpool March
events.description:
It is time for the GDG Liverpool Meetup! Mingle with the local tech community, listen to expert speakers and find out more about the latest technologies, mobile, programming, software and hardware advances.¬†

Agenda:
6:00pm - Arrive, meet & greet
6.30pm - Hello's
6.45pm -¬†Survival of the continuist - Paul Blundell & Xavi Rigau, Novoda
7.30pm - Quick and Dirty - Filipe Barroso, Wingman
8.00pm - Pub!

Abstract:¬†A deep dive into Jenkins Continuos Integration, how you can enable your team to collaborate more, run tests and configure the robots to do all the things for you. Also talking about caveats around automation, testing on real devices, usb hub woes and more.

Speaker: Paul Blundell¬†

Paul Blundell is an aspiring Software Craftsman and Senior Android developer at Novoda. Before Novoda he worked at the AutoTrader and Thales with apps he's released racking up over 1 million downloads. A strong believer in software craftsmanship, SOLID architecture, clean code and testing, Paul has used this methodology to successfully nurture and create many Android applications. These include Channel 4‚Äôs new All4 video streaming application, the Tesco Launcher app; pre-installed for the Hudl2 tablet, MUBI a unique film streaming service and the AutoTrader UK car search app.

Speaker: Xavi Rigau

Xavi started working as an Android Developer in Barcelona 2010, moving to London and joining Novoda in 2013. Bringing experience in cross-platform development, Xavi has pushed Novoda forward with advocating team collaboration and best practices. Working on projects like All4, Secret DJ, MUBI and multiple Tesco products. He‚Äôs now crafting well tested, delightful Android apps in Barcelona.

Abstract:¬†How fast can you create an app from start to publish. Methods and libraries to reduce the development time, ways to prepare yourself for an hackathon or close deadline.

Speaker: Filipe Barroso¬†

Filipe Barroso started out as a freelancer, his first big gig a project was mobile business application for Portugal Telecom, then decided to accept new challenge at Wingman to have the opportunity to work for clients such as Bayer, Brisa, and TAP. Wannabe stand up comedian, failed yoga practitioner, and a furious reader, anything to help improved himself as a person, as a programmer.

events.name: Study Jam - Session 1
events.description:
Join us for a study group around the Google Udacity course which will offer participants the opportunity to receive free, in-person guidance and tutoring.¬†

We will walk you through writing your first Android app and the steps it takes to understanding programming in Android.

The goal of the event is to support as many students as possible in completing the course, thereby raising the technical level of the community.¬†

Please register¬†here¬†for the Udacity course.

Read more here¬†www.developerstudyjams.com

Structure:

Session 1 - Introduction¬†
¬† ¬† ¬†Overview of the Study Jam Sessions¬†
¬† ¬† ¬†Introduction to the Udacity Course¬†
¬† ¬† ¬†Tips & Tricks on completing the Udacity Course¬†
¬† ¬† ¬†Overview of the main programming tasks of the course

Session 2 - Online O&A¬†
¬† ¬† ¬† Open online session aimed at answering any questions generated from completing the first part of the course.

Session 3 - In person Q&A¬†
¬† ¬† ¬† Hands on help on solving the main programming tasks¬†
¬† ¬† ¬† Walk through of the 3 lessons of the Udacity Course.

Recommended Audience:

¬† ¬† ¬†Those new to programming.¬† ¬† ¬†

¬† ¬† ¬†You don't need to know anything, just know how to use your smart phone! ¬† ¬† ¬†

¬† ¬† ¬†Also those with programming experience but who have never used Android.

Agenda:¬†¬†

¬†
6:00pm - Open, arrivals, meet & greet¬†
6.20pm - Hello Everyone!¬†
6.30pm - Session 1 - Introduction

Abstract:¬†Join us for an interactive session where you will get an overview of the 3 Study Jam Sessions and a better understanding of the Udacity Course. In addition to this, Paul & Alex will go through a series of tips & tricks on how to complete the course and how to go through the main programming tasks.¬†

Paul Blundell
Paul Blundell is an aspiring Software Craftsman and Senior Android developer at Novoda with apps he's released racking up over 1 million downloads. A strong believer in software craftsmanship, SOLID architecture, clean code and testing, Paul has used this methodology to successfully nurture and create many Android applications. These include Channel 4‚Äôs new All-4 video streaming application and the Tesco Launcher app; pre-installed for the Hudl2 tablet.

Alex Styl

Alex first started experimenting with Android while trying out ways of making his smartphone faster and prettier. He soon started modifying Android with various themes and later on custom firmware (ROMs). Interested in the process he found himself messing around with Android‚Äôs SDKs building personal and professional apps.¬†Currently Alex is a Software Craftsman at Novoda, delivering usable products such as Channel 4‚Äôs All-4 and the Times newspaper application.

https://plus.google.com/hangouts/_/novoda.com/android

Abstract:¬†Join us for a one hour open online session aimed at answering any questions you might have from completing the first part of the course.

If you're stuck with any particular aspect of the Udacity course or have any questions about programming for this course join us online and ask.

Alex first started experimenting with Android while trying out ways of making his smartphone faster and prettier. He soon started modifying Android with various themes and later on custom firmware (ROMs). events.name: Best Practices of Top-Earning Mobile Apps and Games
events.description:
Come for the free drinks & sandwiches, stay for the awesome talks.

It is time for the GDG Liverpool Meetup! Mingle with the local tech community, listen to expert speakers and find out more about the latest tech advances.

Agenda:
6:00pm - Arrive, meet & greet
6.30pm - Hello's
6.45pm -¬†5 Best Practices of Top-Earning Mobile Apps¬†and Games,¬†Mario Viviani¬†
7.30pm - Getting started with Android Wear Development - Daniele Bonaldo
8.00pm - Pub!

Abstract:¬†Amazon is famously metrics-driven and obsessed with customer satisfaction. In its role as a mobile app publisher, it is perfectly positioned to analyze and interpret millions of mobile downloads and in-app purchases, leading to some surprising and intriguing insights into mobile app engagement and monetization. Here Amazon presents the results of a cohort analysis designed to identify best practices common among the top 50 revenue-generating apps and games in its Amazon Appstore for Android.

Speaker: Mario Viviani

Mario Viviani is Technology Evangelist at Amazon Appstore UK. From Milan, Italy, he started mobile development in 2010, focusing on the Android platform. In 2011 he founded the mobile-focused startup Mariux Apps, developing both consumer-oriented and third-party apps, where he published more than 90 apps and reached more than 12 million total downloads. In 2013 he was awarded by Google of the Google Developer Expert title for Android, and has spoken at worldwide events including Droidcon, Android Developer Days, TEDx and Google I/O.¬†Mario has also been an active part of the startup community. In 2015 he joined Amazon, where as Technology Evangelist he engages with the developer community and companies, presents Amazon newest technologies and ensures mobile app developers are up-to-date on Amazon devices and services.

Abstract:¬†This talk will explore the basics of Android Wear (https://www.android.com/wear/) development focusing on the differences between Wearables and Mobile phone UX and aspects to be considered when developing a Wear-ready app.

Speaker: Daniele Bonaldo

Daniele Bonaldo is an Android software craftsman at Novoda London. He‚Äôs passionate about photography and wearable technologies. Before moving to London, he worked at i‚Äôm Spa, an Italian startup where he had the chance to play with the Android platform while developing one of the first smartwatches on the market ("Doing smartwatches before it was cool" as they said).

events.name: GDG Liverpool: How to approach In-app Billing & Udacity Android Nanodegree
events.description:
Come for the free drinks & sandwiches, stay for the awesome talks.

It is time for the GDG Liverpool Meetup! Mingle with the local tech community, listen to expert speakers and find out more about the latest advances.

Agenda:
6:00pm - Arrive, meet & greet
6.30pm - Hello's
6.45pm -¬†How to approach In-app Billing -¬†Neil Hutchison from Novoda¬†
7.30pm - Udacity Android Nanodegree¬†& the story of a Udacity Student - Andy Parker from Udacity
8.00pm - Pub!

Abstract:¬†

Adding payments can be a daunting task, and something that you want to be bug free. Having recently implemented Play Store in-app billing for an app with over 8 million monthly active users, I will share my journey, giving some insights, helpful tips, and the difficulties we came across. I hope to save you both time and pain by breaking down some issues that will inevitably arise.

Speaker: Neil Hutchison

Neil is an Android Developer most often found coding away at Novoda‚Äôs London office. When he is not working on exciting apps within Novoda, he loves to give back to the community by organising and hosting Londroid (the London Android meet up group), and advocating efficient and effective practices in software and in life.

Abstract:¬†What is a Nanodegree? It is an online training program co-created between Google and Udacity that helps Android professionals and students level up their skills and build their own apps portfolio with interesting projects.Udacity Android Nanodegree lets you build functional, high-performance apps and experiences across multiple Android devices and environments ( phone, tablet, wearables, car & TV). Students also extend a core-app experience leveraging APIs for Google's popular services (Location, Maps, Analytics, Advertising and Identity) and learn how to test, productionize, and publish high-quality apps into the Google Play store.

Speaker: Andy Parker

Andy is one-third of the Udacity team here in the UK. He's working on ensuring Udacity students succeed in growing their careers. Prior to joining Udacity, he was a Co-Founder of Zealify, a London-based¬†startup connecting professionals with career opportunities in high-growth tech companies. You'll often find Andy chatting about education, startups, marketing, hiring and personal/career growth.

events.name: GDG Liverpool: ‚ÄúDDD: The God that Failed?‚Äù
events.description:
Free drinks, sandwiches and awesome talks!

It is time for the GDG Liverpool Meetup! Mingle with the local tech community, listen to expert speakers and find out more about the latest advances.

Agenda:

6:00pm - Arrive, meet & greet

6.30pm - Hello's

6.45pm-¬†‚ÄúDDD: The God that Failed?‚Äù -¬†Gary McLean Hall

7.30pm‚Äì¬†Venturing into the unknown building TendoJobs.com -¬†Michael Cropper

8.00pm - Pub!

Abstract: ‚ÄúDDD: The God that Failed?‚Äù

DDD is rarely applied 'properly'. When directed at the right sort of problem and executed well, DDD is a valid solution. But DDD is over-used, misunderstood, misapplied, deified, and just downright bastardized. It is a small core concept that has gargantuan consequences throughout the solution.

Thankfully, there are alternatives. By following the Single Responsibility Principle at an architectural level, we can create a suite of small, decoupled services with high internal cohesion. These services can be composed and orchestrated in many different ways to solve business problems.

Speaker:¬†Gary McLean Hall

Develop and Architect. Author of "Adaptive Code via C#" and "Pro WPF and Silverlight MVVM". Very sporadic tweeter. Code pedant. Frustrated game developer gone corporate.

Venturing into the unknown building TendoJobs.com

A talk by Michael Cropper, founder of Tendo Jobs, which looks at the technical aspects behind building a tech startup. Starting with the skills required to bring your idea to life, should you be a specialist or a generalist? Then looking at the underlying frameworks, technologies and design patterns required to build solid foundations for growth and scale while keeping things as simple as possible to avoid technical pitfalls. Through to how to deal with the inherent unpredictability of software development to avoid wasting endless time debugging problems that should have never existed in the first place. Looking through the entire process, pitfalls we‚Äôve experienced and how we minimise risk throughout our development using the Model View Controller (MVC) design pattern.

Speaker:¬†Michael Cropper

Michael Cropper is the Managing Director of Digital Agency Contrado Digital and technology startup Tendo Jobs. His day to day activities are very broad, often with a single day spent doing activities ranging from runing events and careers fairs, to delivering workshops and training courses, to pictching for new business, to getting deep into the code enhancing software projects for clients and Tendo Jobs.

events.name: January GDG Liverpool
events.description:
IMPORTANT: We have moved rooms, we're now in 'The Shed'

Access to The Shed is available via the front doors of the campus up until 6:30pm. After this time, the building is only accessible via the 24 hour access door within the creative campus. Some one from the GDG Liverpool team will be there to point you in the right direction.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

It is time for the GDG Liverpool Meetup! Where we mingle with the local tech community, listen to expert speakers and find out more about the latest advances.¬†

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The agenda:¬†

6:00pm ‚Äì Arrive to food, drinks & welcome.¬†

6.30pm - Hello's & introduction.

6.40pm - Zero to Continuous Delivery with Google Cloud Platform

7.20pm ‚Äì Build it together, not the same (codebase)

8.00pm - Pub!¬†

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Speaker: James Heggs

Talk: Zero to Continuous Delivery with Google Cloud Platform

A tutorial talk that will provide detail for creating your GKE cluster, utilising Kubernetes (k8s) and Docker to spin up a Jenkins container, using k8s to spin up Jenkins build agents, defining the build pipeline as code, creating a spring boot app as a docker container and finally deploying the application with k8s. Phew there is a lot to get through‚Ä¶so buckle in we‚Äôre in for the long haul. #buzzwordbingo

Bio: James Heggs co-organises the popular Manchester DevOps meetup. His professional experience has allowed him to work from both sides of the development/operations fence in a variety of commercial and UK governmental organisations. He has a strong sense that ‚Äòculture‚Äô is the most important part of a CALMS environment and a firm belief that the technology choices made during the implementation of a DevOps environments is the ‚Äòeasy part‚Äô.‚Äã

Follow him: @eggsy84¬†

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Speaker: Benjamin Augustin

Title:¬†Build it together, not the same (codebase)

There are many solutions out there to achieve cross platform development on iOS and Android, all of which require compromises. If you are like us, those compromises are not worthwhile and it has prevented you from being able to use any of those solutions for your projects.

Even if we can‚Äôt use a cross platform solution there is a lot we can do to improve the concurrent development of an app on both iOS and Android.

We will show you a push-based architecture that can allow us to use the same terminology and design on both platform. Using Firebase and Reactive Extensions we can create a codebase that is so similar on both platforms that communication is much easier.

We can pair across platforms and when business rules have to change or when bugs are identified it is easy to modify both platforms as the change is virtually the same.

Follow him: @Dorvaryn

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

üìß¬†If you‚Äôre interested in speaking, getting involved, sponsoring or have some feedback, drop us an email:¬†

[masked]

Follow us: @gdg_liverpool¬†

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

See you there!¬†

events.name: March GDG Liverpool
events.description:
Join us for the March GDG Liverpool Meetup!¬†Where the local tech community comes together to listen to expert speakers, find out more about the latest advances, followed by a good pub social. ¬†

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This months agenda:

6:00pm ‚Äì Arrive to food, drinks & welcome

6.30pm - Hello's & introduction

6.40pm ‚Äì Android Things - Paul Blundell & Xavi Rigau¬†

7.40pm ‚Äì Pub!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Talk: Android Things

Android Things is Googles latest foray into the Internet of Things. Android Things lets you build professional, mass-market products on a trusted platform, without previous knowledge of embedded system design. IoT devices need testing too. We will talk about how to architect your Android Things applications to enable testing and explore a ports and adapters architecture to keep your codebase clean and your IoT devices solid.¬†

The second half of the talk will be a deeper dive into controlling Android Things peripherals. We'll explain what are user drivers, how they work, how to use them, and most importantly: how you can create and test a new driver from scratch that can be used from Android Things to interact with new peripherals.

Speaker: <a>Paul Blundell¬†</a>

Paul Blundell is an aspiring Software Craftsman, Google Developer Expert and Head of Engineering at Novoda. Before Novoda he worked at the AutoTrader and Thales with apps he's personally released racking up over 1 million downloads. A strong believer in software craftsmanship, SOLID architecture, clean code and testing, Paul has used this methodology to successfully nurture and create many Android applications. These include Channel 4‚Äôs All4 video streaming application, the Tesco Launcher app; pre-installed for the Hudl2 tablet, MUBI a unique film streaming service. Paul is also the author of "Learning Android Application Testing".

Speaker: Xavi Rigau¬†

Xavi started working as an Android Developer in Barcelona 2010, moving to London and joining Novoda in 2013. Bringing experience in cross-platform development, Xavi has pushed Novoda forward with advocating team collaboration and best practices. Working on projects like All4, Secret DJ, MUBI and multiple Tesco products. He‚Äôs now crafting well tested, delightful Android apps in Barcelona.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Follow us: @gdg_liverpool¬†

Contact us: [masked]¬†

#gdg_liverpool¬†

events.name: July GDG Liverpool - Codelab
events.description:
It is time for the GDG Liverpool Meetup!

Where we mingle with the local tech community, listen to expert speakers and find out more about the latest advances.¬†

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------¬†

This month's agenda:

6:00pm ‚Äì Arrival: food, drinks & welcome

6.30pm - Hello's & introduction

6.35 pm ‚Äì Firebase App on Assistant¬†codelab

7:30 - Pub!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------¬†

Welcome to the Firebase App on Assistant codelab. In this codelab, you'll learn how to use Firebase, API.AI, and Google Assistant to create an App on Assistant.

What are you going to build in this codelab?

‚Ä¢¬†You will build an App on Assistant composed of code and data

‚Ä¢¬†hosted by Firebase on the backend,¬†

‚Ä¢¬†conversational logic defined by API. AI,

‚Ä¢¬†with interactions through a Google Assistant emulator.

‚Ä¢¬†It will be coded to play a guessing game where the player thinks of an animal, and the app asks a series of yes/no question in an attempt to guess the animal.

‚Ä¢¬†At the end, if it did not guess the animal correctly, it will ask the player to give it another question to help it guess better in the future.

What you'll learn

‚Ä¢¬†Read and write data using the Firebase Realtime Database.

‚Ä¢¬†Write and deploy server-side code with Cloud Functions for Firebase written in JavaScript.

‚Ä¢¬†Define the flow of automated conversation with API.AI, and fulfill its requests with an endpoint you provide with Cloud Functions.

‚Ä¢¬†How to build an App on Assistant for the Google Assistant

What you'll need:¬†

Node.js

Firebase CLI

Laptop

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Follow us:¬†@gdg_liverpool¬†

Contact us:¬†[masked]¬†

#gdg_liverpool¬†

events.name: August - Test-driven development, featuring Kotlin!
events.description:
Join us for the August GDG Liverpool Meetup!

---------------------

The agenda:

6:00pm ‚Äì Arrival, drinks & welcome

6.30pm - Hello's & introduction

6.35 pm ‚Äì Test-driven ¬†development

7:30 - Pub!

---------------------¬†

Details:

In this demo, we'll be implementing a simple app that keeps the score of a ten-pin bowling game, using test-driven design, pair programming and Kotlin.

Kotlin is the newly-Google-supported language from JetBrains, the company behind IDEs such as WebStorm, Android Studio and IntelliJ IDEA. It's concise, statically typed and runs on the JVM, and it's one of the fastest growing languages in the world, according to the Tiobe Index. Come along and see what it can do.

We've chosen to put Kotlin and our TDD skills through their paces by going over a classic kata from Uncle Bob Martin. Using only tests to guide us, we'll (hopefully) code up a fully working app that can keep score of a ten pin bowling game.

We'll be following the guidelines of TDD by using ping pong pairing - one person writing a failing test, the other making it pass, then switching.

For those of you that aren't familiar with test-driven approaches, this is an ideal opportunity to see how they can benefit you.¬†

For those that are familiar with TDD, it's an ideal opportunity to come and tell us where we're going wrong!

What to bring:¬†

This is a live coding demonstration so you won't need to bring along your laptop, but if you want to code along with what we're doing you're more than welcome. To do that you'll need working IDE such as IntelliJ or Android Studio, with the Kotlin plugin installed, and a good grasp of the rules of ten pin bowling.

Hosted by: Paul Davies,¬†Niamh Power & Joe Timmins

events.name: GDG Liverpool: Amazon
events.description:
Join us for the Amazon September GDG Liverpool Meetup!¬†

Where the local tech community comes together to listen to expert speakers, find out more about the latest advances, followed by a good social.¬†

TO ATTEND THIS EVENT PLEASE REGISTER ON EVENTBRITE HERE >¬†

-----------------------------------------------------¬†

Schedule

6:00 - Open for arrivals

6:40 - Welcome & Introduction¬†

6:45 - Talk one -¬†Building New User Experiences with Amazon Fire TV

7:15 - Q&A

7:25 ¬†- Talk two -¬†Alexa Everywhere

7:55 - Q&A

8:05 - Drinks & social

8:30 - Event close¬†

-----------------------------------------------------------

Talk One: Building New User Experiences with Amazon Fire TV

Mobile development is not just about mobile devices anymore: Android scaled up from mobile devices to the TV screen, and developers have now the occasion to start building for a brand new use case: the 10-foot experience. In this session, we cover what's needed to bring high-performing Media Streaming Android Apps to Fire TV and how to use powerful new tools to create rich living room experiences for your users.¬†

Speaker: Mario Viviani



Talk Two: Alexa Everywhere¬†

We are currently witnessing the greatest shift in consumer behaviour since the move from web experience to the ‚Äòmobile moment‚Äô, and it‚Äôs all around us. Reminders, music, shopping, information, smart home control and more can now be summoned with just a simple utterance, enabled by devices which don‚Äôt resemble the grey-box computer or the smart phones we‚Äôve grown used to.¬†

In this talk we will discuss:¬†

- How the Alexa community creates more and more delightful experiences for customers every day¬†

- How Alexa helps people with their daily lives in so many ways¬†

- What we mean by Alexa being truly everywhere

Speaker: David Low¬†

David Low is Principal Evangelist for Amazon‚Äôs Alexa Skills Kit (ASK) in Europe, working with developers to create new and innovate experiences around voice. David has held several technical leadership roles during a career spanning almost 20 years, and, prior to joining Amazon, created and led the Developer Relations team at Skyscanner. David has a passion for early adoption of technology, with a particular interest in digital media, and has a track record of working with partners to develop new products, including Skyscanner‚Äôs bots and voice services, and Scottish Television‚Äôs highly-rated STV Player.¬†

David Low ‚Äì Principal Evangelist, Alexa Skills Kit EU

@daviddlow (twitter / LinkedIn)¬†

-----------------------------------------------------------
Follow us: @gdg_liverpool

events.name: IoT & ML, Tensor Flow with Android Things WorkShop
events.description:
LIMITED TO 20 SPACES. To guarantee your spot at the workshop, please register on Eventbrite here >

Novoda, the organisers behind GDG Liverpool will be donating devices used to the DoEs Liverpool device library following the event.


Schedule will be:

6:30 - Arrival

7:00 - Workshop starts

8:30 - ¬†Finish

Details

Android Things makes developing connected embedded devices easy by providing the same Android development tools, best-in-class Android framework, and Google APIs that make developers successful on mobile. With the TensorFlow inference library for Android, developers can easily integrate TensorFlow and machine learning into their apps on Android Things.

At this meetup, we will provide 4 set of boards for you to have a go at Android IoT with TensorFlow Machine Learning image classification. You will use the TensorFlow inference library for Android to build a device that captures images from the device camera and locally classifies them against a pre-trained ImageNet model.

What you'll learn

- How to integrate the TensorFlow inference library into AndroidThings

- How to feed data into a TensorFlow model

- How to capture an image using the Android camera APIs

We have a small number of hardware sets for people. If you do want to buy the hardware yourself and bring it along you will need:

Raspberry Pi 3 or i.MX7D developer board

Camera module

Rainbow HAT for Android Things

One place you can buy the kits is here: http://www.technexion.com/solutions/iot-development-platform/android-things/

Software, please have this installed:

Android Studio 3.0+

Hosted by: Paul Blundell¬†

events.name: Codelab:  Face Detection with the Mobile Vision API
events.description:
Happy New Year. We will be kicking of 2018 with a codelab held at Launch 22. The agenda:

6:15pm ‚Äì Arrival, drinks & welcome
6.30pm - Hello's & introduction
6.35 pm ‚Äì Codelab - Face Detection with the Mobile Vision API
7:45pm - Pub

------------
Details: With the release of Google Play services 7.8, you can now use new Mobile Vision APIs which provide new Face Detection APIs that find human faces in image and video better and faster than before, and which offer smart services such as understanding faces at different orientations, detecting facial features, and understanding facial expressions.

Prerequisites: Before beginning, check that you have all the necessary prerequisites. These include:

> Android Studio
> An Android Device that runs Android 4.2.2 or later -or- A configured Android Emulator (this is available in Android Studio)
> The latest version of the Android SDK including the SDK tools component. You can get this from the Android SDK Manager in Android Studio.
> The Google Play Services SDK. You can get this from the Android SDK Manager in Android Studio.

Codelab: https://codelabs.developers.google.com/codelabs/face-detection/index.html?index=..%2F..%2Findex#0

Hosted by: Niamh Power & Joe Timmins

events.name: Codelab: Write Your First Flutter App, part 1
events.description:
This month we are hosting the codelab 'Write Your First Flutter App, part 1'

In this codelab, you'll create a simple Flutter app. If you are familiar with object-oriented code and basic programming concepts such as variables, loops, and conditionals, you can complete this codelab. You don't need previous experience with Dart or mobile programming.
------------------------------------------------------------------

üí°What you'll learn in part 1

How to write a Flutter app that looks natural on both iOS and Android.
Basic structure of a Flutter app.
Finding and using packages to extend functionality.
Using hot reload for a quicker development cycle.
How to implement a stateful widget.
How to create an infinite, lazily loaded list.

------------------------------------------------------------------

üìùSchedule

events.name: October GDG - Kotlin!
events.description:
This session will be about one of the fastest growing languages in the world, Kotlin!

It‚Äôs a concise, modern language that can run in the browser, on the JVM, on Android and as a stand-alone binary.

Some real world products that run on Kotlin include Uber, Monzo, Coursera, Pinterest, Evernote, All4, and Deliveroo.

First off we‚Äôll go through some of the more technical aspects, and then talk about the benefits it can bring to your development process.

Following on from that, we‚Äôll be demonstrating how Kotlin works by running through the Gilded Rose kata. An idea taken from martial arts, katas are a great way of learning a new language, by taking you through well-defined concepts, in a step-by-step fashion.

We‚Äôll also form into groups to work through the problem together and share some knowledge.

What to bring:

This is a live coding demonstration so you won‚Äôt need to bring along your laptop, but if you want to do so you‚Äôre more than welcome. You can do this with a text editor and command line tools, but the easiest option is the free community version of IntelliJ or Android Studio, with the Kotlin plugin installed.

There will be some food and drink provided and we‚Äôll go for some drinks afterward.

Hosted by: Niamh Power & Joe Timmins

events.name: A night of technology
events.description:
To celebrate the end of 2018 and a fantastic year for both Swift Society and GDG Liverpool, we are going to be running a very special event.

We will be getting a range of speakers covering all topics in technology, from design to development, in the form of short lightning talks.

We now have over 15 speakers, with talks ranging from the user experience in crowdfunding campaigns to videography and the future of mobile in retail. It's set to be a fantastic night, so be sure to sign up, as we will have limited space!

There will be food & drink, lots of mince pies and merriment to go around, and we will be following the talks with an end of year social!

*Schedule*

6:30pm - Doors open
6:50pm - First set of talks
7:30pm - 15 minute break
7:50pm - Second set of talks
8:30-9:00pm - Head to the pub!

*Speakers*

James Parr - Jack-All Productions - videography and editing as part of Jack-All

Adrian McEwen - MCQN Ltd - Beyond Glowing Rectangles

Dave Martin - Funding Circle - Datomic, an immutable database

Hannah Forbes - The Funding Crowd - Creating a successful crowdfunding campaign: Understanding how users interact with crowdfunding sites

David Challener - Uniform - Web performance

Giles Airey - Inviqa - If not us then who?

Richard Pay - Uniform - The future agency

James Halsall - Inviqa - Short-circuit your feedback loops

Joe Timmins - Novoda - Worse is Better

Niamh Power - Monzo - Why not both?

events.name: GDG Liverpool: "Better Together" at Monzo
events.description:
This month, we will be hosting Niamh Power, Mobile Engineer at Monzo and Google Developer Expert in Firebase, to give her talk "Better Together".

An organiser of GDG Liverpool herself, she may be a familiar face to some of you. She will be bringing this talk to you after presenting it at Droidcon Berlin 2019.

Talk abstract:

"Across the mobile industry, there is often this great divide between the two platforms, iOS, and Android. The consumer arguments of which side is better, and what phones are better regularly leak into our work and quite frankly taint our ability to make great applications for our users. As developers, we are sometimes subject to the whims and biases of designers and product managers. However, we have to take responsibility for ensuring that our mobile products as a whole are enjoyable and consistent for our users. At Monzo, there is a culture of collaboration, which has resulted in the mobile apps becoming closer and closer in feature parity. However, there are still issues, and definitely lessons from the past, which I will detail in this talk. I will also delve into the issues with the more black and white thought processes that plague the industry, what damage they can cause and how much of a detriment to your product they can be. She will then go on to explain how, by working together and appreciating the benefits of both sides, you can ultimately design and build apps that everybody will love, and also be happier in our work.

Venue: The Baltic Roastery

organizers.name: Niamh P.
organizers.bio: Mobile Engineer @ Monzo, working remotely in North Wales! Organiser of GDG Liverpool & the Swift Society Liverpool. Speaker - message me if you need one for your event!
